16:22 <+sburjan`> cjdelisle: around ?  
16:22 <@cjdelisle> yea  
16:22 <+sburjan`> question  
16:23 <Chami2> has joined #xwiki  
16:24 <+sburjan`> I am serializing a java Object using (java.io.Serializable) that has a instantiated object in it, but that object isEmpty(). After deserializing the object, the previous empty object withing is null, and thus I get a NPE. Any idea what is the strategy here ?  
16:24 <@cjdelisle> is the contained object also serializable?  
16:24 <alokdrocks> has joined #xwiki  
16:25 <Chami1> has quit  
16:25 <+sburjan`> ye, the serialization is successful. Even the deserialization is successful. But the object within the big object is now null.  
16:26 <+sburjan`> it's like it doesn't been instantiated  
16:26 <Enygma`> has quit  
16:26 <@cjdelisle> but both objects implement Serializable, correct?  
16:26 <+sburjan`> yes, all of them (that are involved in serialization process)  
16:27 <@cjdelisle> hmm, that's supposed to work  
16:28 <@cjdelisle> idk read up on serialization, see if you can find code to examine the object in serialized state and good luck.  
16:28 <@cjdelisle> :)  
16:29 <+sburjan`> it's a little bit odd.. because I get NPE when printing on screeh the things I need. and if the object is obtained directly (without serialization) it works. If I get the object from deserializing it, it doesn't  
16:37 <kasun> has joined #xwiki  
16:41 <kasunbg> has quit

17:54 <drake01> has joined #xwiki  
18:03 <pulasthi> has joined #xwiki  
18:14 <@cjdelisle> oh, fyi I fixed the problem with maven getting bad data from github, it was Todd's problem but I found a workaround.  
18:15 <pulasthi> cjdelisle: ahh thats great  
18:15 <pulasthi> :)  
18:17 <@cjdelisle> I also proved the first step is possible, I can generate groovy classes and persist them so user generated objects can be converted to groovy classes, compiled, optimized and stored.  
18:17 <@cjdelisle> just a fyi, go do something fun, it's Saturday!  
18:19 <pulasthi> cjdelisle: its 10pm over here i just came back from and its kind of new year seson here  
18:20 <pulasthi> \*just came back from small trip  
18:21 <@cjdelisle> cool  
18:21 <pulasthi> cjdelisle:btw xwiki only got 3 slots right  
18:21 <pulasthi> :(  
18:23 <@cjdelisle> I heard something like that.  
18:23 <pulasthi> thats very bad news  
18:24 <pulasthi> for me at least  
18:24 <@cjdelisle> yea, can't know until the end. AFAIK your application has not been thrown out yet.  
18:25 <pulasthi> :)  
18:25 <pulasthi> yeah have to wait till 25th right  
18:26 <@cjdelisle> I don't really know anything about gsoc specifically.  
18:26 <pulasthi> ahh np  
18:26 <pulasthi> :)  
18:27 <@cjdelisle> If what you're really looking for is experience then you don't have to do gsoc, you can just start lurking around any open project you like.  
18:29 <pulasthi> yeah but  gosc gives a lot of motivation  
18:29 <pulasthi> anyway even if im not selected i want just let go of work in this area  
18:29 <pulasthi> :)  
18:30 <@cjdelisle> ofc, everyone wants a paycheck. Still having something you can tell an employer: "Oh yea, I have field experience I worked on XWiki"  
18:30 <@cjdelisle> hahaha freudian slip, want instead of won't :P  
18:31 <pulasthi> ahh well its just keeps poping up too much of chats with friends  
18:35 <pulasthi> cjdelisle: had a long day so got to get some rest  
18:36 <pulasthi> cjdelisle: ill try to get ur implementaion runing tommorw  
18:36 <pulasthi> :)  
18:36 <pulasthi> see you  
18:36 <florinciu> has quit  
18:37 <@cjdelisle> see ya
